title: Ticket #3416: condor_q analyze doesn't handle complex requirements.
description:
Analysis of requirements expressions should be improved to evaluate all of the sub-clauses of the expression, and not just the top level clauses joined by &&. Since this can produce substantially more output, it will most likely be necessary to alter the output format somewhat to draw attention to the clauses that fail to match any/many machines.

The values of job attributes referenced in the requirements expression should be printed out as part of this analysis. When matching against a single machine, the values of machine attributes referenced should also be printed out.

It may be useful to add the ability for the user to specify a level of verbosity for analysis and to request that the matching impact of ALL clauses be printed out, or only those clauses that the analysis deems to be problematic.
